artifact.content: Interface for Administrator to monitor and control the system.
There is only one Administrator account.
Administrator logs into the console using a name/password combination.
The console should validate the login name/password combination.
All console features are accessible by every Administrator.
The console is only on the server machine.
The system may be extended to handle access by multiple Administrators at the same time.
The system should validate all data inputted by Administrators and display errors.
The console allows the display of all assigned phone numbers.
The console allows the display of all assigned IP addresses.
The console allows the Administrator to search for an unassigned phone number.
The console allows the association of a phone number with an IP address.
The console supports users.
The console supports accounts.
The console allows the association of a user to an account.
The console allows the association of an account to a phone number and IP.
User and account information is stored indefinitely in the system.
The console supports billing plans.
The console displays the status of each phone.
The console displays the error log for the system.
The system console must alert the Administrator if there is an error.
The console allows the Administrator to conduct tests on the system.
The console allows the Administrator to request tests to be conducted at regular intervals.
The console allows Administrators to remove a phone from service.
The console allows Administrators to enable a phone.
The console allows Administrator to reset the call processing software.
The console allows the Administrator to set the maximum number of simultaneous calls.
The console displays the system load.
The console calculates a suggested maximum number of simultaneous calls.
The console displays any user�s bill for any billing period.
The console allows the Administrators to enter payment information on an account.
The console allows the Administrator to generate bills for each account.
The console displays a list of all overdue accounts.
Each user should store name and accounts.
Each account should store phone number and billing plan.
Phone numbers can be re-used.
Each account may possess different call privileges to originate and receive calls in terms of filters.
Status checks can be requested for the system.
Error logs are maintained by the system.
Administrator can request hardware test at any time to verify the hardware�s function.
Automated hardware tests will be performed regularly.
A phone can be set to �out of service� status if there is a hardware problem.
A phone can be enabled by administrator if there is a repaired or newly added hardware.
The system console must be able to receive error message from the hardware phone.
The system supports changes to the maximum number of simultaneous calls in the system.
Callee�s phone displays caller�s number.
Off-hook starts dial tone.
The input of first digit would stop the dial tone and start dialling process.
After the user dials four digits, the server should attempt to establish a connection.
Caller hears busy signal when connecting to an off-hook callee.
Caller hears busy signal when an invalid number dialled.
Caller hears ring tone and callee�s phone rings when connecting to an on-hook callee.
Stop connection attempt after 30 seconds had passed.
Stop dialing after 20 seconds had passed.
Stop dial tone after 20 seconds had passed.
Connect caller and callee and establish audio connection after callee off-hook.
Call is disconnected after either callee or caller on-hook.
Once received a reset signal from the server, the phone must reset itself and return to the initial state of operation.
Server maintains a count of the number of simultaneous calls.
When the number of simultaneous calls is equal or above the value defined, any connection attempt always produces fast busy tone.
Phone numbers contain four digits.
Phone numbers are mapped to IP addresses.
Billing system must keep a record of every established call on every account.
Call rate is calculated based on billing plan of account.
Each billing period is one month.
A bill for each account is generated and sent to its user at the end of each billing period.
A bill is immediately generated and sent to a user whose account is cancelled.
Each bill shows the account history and charges within its billing period.
A bill is generated for each account (not user).
There are three types of charges: calls, fines, and taxes
Each call has an associated charge (cost) based on a variety of factors.
A 10% compounded interest is charged on overdue accounts.
Tax (in percentage) can be applied on taxable charges.
Only certain types of charges are taxable.
Charge calculation is performed at the end of each call and logged in the call history.
A report is generated for the Administrator at the end of each billing period listing all accounts that have not been paid for two months.
Billing plan is used to determine call rate at a certain time.
Billing plans can be added or modified.
Calls started during the discount period are charged a discounted rate.
A discount rate allows only a percentage of the regular rate to be charged on calls.
The behaviour of the IP phone system should be similar to traditional phones from the perspective of its users.
The system should be reliable at all times.
Users� personal and billing information should be protected.
The system should be able to handle as many simultaneous connections as possible.
The system should be user-friendly. The user and administrator should be able to adapt to the system very easily.
